ACTERIA Doctoral Thesis Prizes in allergology

The ACTERIA Prizes consist of four prizes being awarded by the European Federation of Immunological Societies (EFIS). It shall distinguish high potential early career researchers, two each in Immunology and Allergology to acknowledge outstanding achievement in fundamental research in an institute from a European country.

Allergopharma Award
The award was established in 2000, on the initiative of Allergopharma, in collaboration with the European Academy of Allergy and Clinical Immunology. It is intended that the Award should recognize the scientific achievements of young scientists working in the field of allergy and encourage their engagement in further research.

Pfizer Forschungspreis in der Kategorie Infektiologie, Rheumatologie und Immunologie

Der Pfizer Forschungspreis ist einer der bedeutendsten Medizin Forschungspreise der Schweiz. Er wird jungen Wissenschaftlerinnen und Wissenschaftlern verliehen, die an Schweizer Forschungsinstituten oder Spitälern herausragende und zukunftsweisende Beiträge im Bereich Grundlagenforschung oder klinische Forschung erbracht haben.

Dr. Lutz Zwillenberg Prize

Up to three prizes are awarded once a year for scientific work in the field of biological sciences. The prize is intended to motivate young talents who have submitted innovative work in the form of a PhD dissertation or an outstanding publication as a Postdoc.
The prize is awarded in memory of the biologist Dr. Lutz O. Zwillenberg, who passed away in December 2011. The University of Bern thanks the prize sponsors, the couple Dr. Celia und Dr. Lutz Zwillenberg.

The role of the Thayer Lindsley Visiting Lecturer is to serve as an ambassador for SEG, lecturing at colleges and universities to inspire the next generation of economic geologists. The lecturer is selected based on a combination of scholarship, leadership, communication skills, and ability to engage and connect with a diverse group of students.
